recipie_instructions:
1. Heat oven to 200 degrees (180 for fan ovens)
  2. In 3 baking trays, set out your flour, egg and breadcrumbs
  3. coat each fish in turn.
  4. Put in oven for 30 mins

Sauté the chopped mushrooms in olive oil. When just cooked, blend in a food processor with the black olives, chopped parsley, at least 2 cloves of garlic (more if liked), the olive paste and chopped chilli if used.

Meanwhile, put the pasta on to cook - tagliatelle is nice with this sauce - but other forms are just as nice.

Melt a knob of butter in a saucepan and cook the olive mixture gently for a five minutes. Season. Then add 3 or 4 tablespoons of fromage frais, crème fraîche or cream depending on your taste, and season again. Add about 2 oz freshly grated Parmesan and the cooked pasta.

Serve with more fresh Parmesan.
recipie_ingredients:
• 6 oz Mushrooms (chopped)
  • 2 tsp Olive Paste
  • 8 oz Black Olives (pitted)
  • 1 Chilli Pepper(optional)
  • 3 Tbs Parsley (chopped)
  • As Req Olive Oil
  • 2 cloves Garlic
  • 1 knob Butter
  • 3 or 4 Tbs Fromage Frais; Creme Fraîche or Cream (as liked)
  • As Req Parmesan Cheese (freshly grated)

recipie_instructions:
1. Mix together the mince, gherkins, parsley, egg yolk & plenty of salt and pepper.
  2. Shape the mixture into even-sized burgers.
  3. Brush the burgers with a little oil & cook in a hot frying pan for 3-6 mins on each side until well browned.
  4. Meanwhile, stir together the mustard& mayonnaise then gently fold in the blue cheese.
  5. Serve the burgers in seeded buns, toasted on the cut side only, with plenty of salad & a good dollop of the mayonnaise mix.
recipie_ingredients:
• 250g LeanBeef Mince
  • 1 tbs Dijon Mustard
  • 4sml Gherkins - chopped
  • 6 tbs Mayonnaise
  • 3tbs Parsley
  • 50g Blue Cheese
  • 1 Egg Yolk
  • Salt & Pepper
  • 1tbs Sunflower Oil
  • Seeded Burger Buns
  • Shredded Lettuce and Sliced Tomatoes to serve.

recipie_instructions:
Wipe & slice the mushrooms. Peel, core & slice the apples. Skin & finely slice the onion.

Butter a 3 pint shallow ovenproof dish. Place prepared onions, mushrooms and apples in base, season well and add herbs. Place pork chops/steaks on top,and cover with cider. Mix breadcrumbs and cheese together and sprinkle over chops.

Bake at 200ºC  [400ºF/Gas Mk 6] for 1¼ - 1½ hours until chops/steaks are tender.
recipie_ingredients:
• 4 Pork Chops or Steaks
  • ½ pt Cider
  • 4 oz Mushrooms
  • 2 oz Breadcrumbs
  • 2Bramley Apples
  • ½ tsp Mixed Herbs
  • 1 Onion
  • Salt and Pepper
  • 4 oz Cheddar Cheese (grated)

recipie_instructions:
Put all the ingredients in a food processor, and mix until thoroughly combined. Using a meat baller, open, scoop up a portion of mince mixture then squeeze together firmly. Open and place on a baking sheet. Chill until required.


TO COOK


IN THE OVEN - Arrange the meatballs in a shallow roasting tray a little apart and cook at 200ºC/400ºF/Gas Mk 6 for 25 minutes or until tender and cooked through.




TO FRY- Cook meat balls in a single layer in vegetable oil for 10-15 minutes turning frequently. Drain on kitchen paper.




TO MICROWAVE - Arrange 6 meatballs on a microwave proof plate lined with kitchen paper. Cover loosely with kitchen paper and microwave on HIGH for 4 minutes. Allow to stand for 2-3 minutes.




TO STEAM - Arrange meatballs in a single layer in a steamer. Fix lid on top and steam for 15 minutes or until cooked through.




TO SIMMER - Use stock or a good flavoured sauce, such as tomato, and simmer in a shallow frying pan for20 minutes, turning occasionally.
recipie_ingredients:
• 450 g Lean Mince (Pork, Lamb or Beef)
  • 1 clove Garlic(crushed)
  • ¼ tsp Dried Oregano or Mixed Herbs
  • 1 Onion (chopped)
  • 25 g Wholemeal Breadcrumbs  
  • Salt & Ground Black Pepper
